results.title: This way up
results.creator_credit: Mike Jackson and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
James Burke goes to the top of the Blackpool Tower and turns upside down to discover how the ears talk to the eyes and how we know which way is down. Looks at the sense of balance and other ways we perceive which way is up. The use of vision and retinal cells to detect movement and distance is studied in detail.
Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: This vital earth
results.creator_credit: George E. Brewer Jnr, New York Zoological Society and The Conservation Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Living Earth”
The relation of life to its environment is shown through the balance of plants and animals. The film shows that plant and animal inter-relationships are essential for the survival of both.

results.title: This time, next time
results.creator_credit: Robin de Crespigny and Honky Tonk Angel Productions
results.brief_description: This program reveals the alarming facts about the condition of Alcohol Related Brain Damage (ARBD) showing how it takes a comparatively small quantity of alcohol and a short amount of time to cause significant and irreparable damage to the brain. “This Time, Next Time” combines both documentary and dramatic filmmaking techniques and cleverly intercuts actual medical experts, brain damaged patients and their families, with dramatic sequences. Cast includes Nicholas Gledhill, Patrick Dickson, Michele Fawdon, Kate Fitzpatrick, Kerry Mack, Terence Donovan.

results.title: This side of paradise: fragments of an unfinished biography
results.brief_description: Lithuanian born curator, writer and avant garde filmmaker, Jonas Mekas has created this piece of artwork on film through images captured during his stay over several summers in a rented beach house (belonging to Andy Warhol) at Montauk in the late 60s early 70s with Jackie Kennedy and her sister, Lee Radziwill, and their children. Jackie co-opted Mekas into introducing Caroline and John Jr to home movies as a way of distracting them from the tragic loss of their father. This is the result of those wonderfully innocent, somewhat fragile, summer days - an eclectic mixture of old photographs and movie camera images of the Kennedy family and their cousins, brought together in fragmented, sometimes distorted or over-exposed, flashing images accompanied by a combined soundtrack of music, percussion, natural sounds of wind and surf, and the voices of the children often muffled and intermittent. Mekas has also woven some evocative images of a very young Jackie Bouvier Kennedy into this fascinating visual glimpse of one of America’s most famous families.
results.title_for_label: This side of paradise: fragments of an unfinished biography

results.title: This one with that one: math readiness
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Math readiness”
Uses a story about a fisherman who cannot decide how to match his lines, baits and fish, in order to illustrate the concept of one-to-one matching.
Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: This nuclear age
results.creator_credit: Sally Macdonald, Jim Turpie, Crawley Films and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Since the first film was made explaining the power of the atom, nuclear technology has made great advances. This film is an up-to-date account of the many areas of nuclear research and recent developments in Canada. It was filmed at the long-functioning atomic reactors at Chalk River and Rolphton, and at the latest and largest atomic power station at Pickering, as well as at laboratories across the land where experimentation is carried out in both pure and applied nuclear science.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sally Macdonald, Jim Turpie, Crawley Films and ONF | NFB

results.title: This model age
results.brief_description: Shows the skill and ingenuity involved in making radio-controlled, diesel-engined and electric-powered toy models. The models range from conventional aircraft, trains and boats to futuristic transport designed for space exploration

results.title: This marching girl thing
results.creator_credit: Kelli Simpson and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Cindy (Toni Collette), a baton twirler with the Southern Twirlettes is competing in the Victorian Baton Twirlers competition, her girlfriend Alison (Jenny Apostolou), and boyfriend Peter (Matt Day) in tow. As the results are announced, she questions whether she should continue pursuing “this marching girl thing”, and whether she should continue with Alison or Peter.

results.title: This life
results.brief_description: ‘This life’ - the series following the life and loves of twenty something solicitors, Anna, Miles, Milly, Egg and Warren earned itself a legion of loyal fans when it originally screened in 1997. Series devised by Amy Jenkins.
